task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 52°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The top of the building is not fully visible, so I need to tilt my view upwards to see the entire structure before I can estimate its height.
I have seen the top of the building, and now I need to look down to see its base to get a complete view for height estimation.

Having viewed the top and bottom of the building, I can now estimate its height by counting the floors; it appears to have about 8 floors, and assuming a standard floor height of 3 meters, the total height is approximately 24 meters.
